text: What do you regard as your strongest source of creative inspiration?
answers: From within (e.g., dreams, meditation, daydreaming)
From outside (e.g., reading, events, conversation, observations outside)

text: What is the breadth of your creative interests?
answers: My interests are very focused in one area
My interests broadly span many areas

text: What factors are most significant in motivating your creative work?
answers: Internal (e.g., a need to express myself)
External (e.g., sense of acheivement, pleasing others, earning a living)

text: How easy is it for you to do mediocre work if it seems prudent?
answers: It's easy
It's extremely difficult

text: Do you tend be more self-critical or more self-assured in your creative work?
answers: Self-Critical
Self-Assured

text: How do you typically feel while you are creative problem solving or working on a creative project?
answers: Happy / It flows easily
"Tortured" / It's a struggle

text: When a significant risk is involved in my creative endeavors...
answers: I do what I can to minimize it
I get excited about the possibilities

text: Are you able to be creative when performing for others?
answers: No, peforming for others is creatively stifling
Yes, performing for others creatively stimulating

text: How often do you engage in creative collaboration?
answers: I tend to work on solo endeavors
I often engage in collaborative endeavors

text: On average, how many creative projects do you work on simultaneously?
answers: I prefer one project at a time
I prefer many projects at once

text: How do you feel about the role of constraints in your creative process?
answers: Constraints stifle my creativity
Constraints stimulate my creativity

text: Broadly speaking, how do you feel about the role of distractions in your creative process?
answers: Love Distractions (e.g. they are a source of new ideas)
Hate Distractions (e.g. they impede my creative thinking)

text: How much variation is there in the rate at which you do creative work?
answers: My creative work is relatively stable or consistent
My creative work is highly variable or erratic

text: How do you feel about group brainstorming sessions?
answers: I hate them, I'm more creative if I can generate ideas on my own
I love them, I'm creatively stimulated when brainstorming in real-time with others

text: Compared to others, how rapidly do you tend to generate new ideas or possible solutions?
answers: I need time to let my ideas surface
I get new ideas by the minute

text: How do you envision and implement your creative projects?
answers: I know what I want to achieve and execute a plan
I follow my intuition and let the vision crystalize as I work

text: To what degree does your creative work involve the element of chance?
answers: Rarely, I make circumstances happen
Always, I let circumstances unfold

text: When your initial plans for creative work don't pan out, how quickly do you typically move to Plan B?
answers: I figure out a way to make Plan A work
I quickly reframe and move to Plan B

text: If you had to pick one, in which of the following stages of the creative process do you feel most confident?
answers: Defining the problem
Generating lots of ideas or possible solutions
Picking the winning solutions from the options
Executing and getting things done
It Varies

text: How compelled would you be to clean a messy workspace before beginning your creative work?
answers: Not at all, a little mess is comforting
Extremely, a sharp mind needs a sharp pencil

text: What kind of space is most productive for you when you are working on a creative project?
answers: Private spaces (e.g., at home, a private office or studio)
Public spaces (e.g., coffee shops, open workspaces)

text: What noise level is most comfortable for you when you are working on a creative project?
answers: Total silence or minimal background music or noise
Loud music or lots of background noise

text: How important do you think physical exercise and/or movement is to being creative in your work?
answers: Unimportant
Very important

text: I'm most creative if my surroundings and routine are...
answers: Varied and dynamic
Consistent and stable

text: If you could choose, what time of day do you prefer to do creative work?
answers: Early Morning
Midday
Afternoon
Late Night
It Varies / No Preference.

text: How important to your creative process is it that you spend time outdoors in nature?
answers: Unimportant
Extremely important
